name: Conditional-computation-library
tagline: This library is developed to perform conditional computations on Dempster-Shafer belief theory
body:
### Dempster-Shafer(DS) theory
The Dempster-Shafer (DS) theory of belief functions, also referred to as evidence theory, was first introduced by Dempster [1](http://www.stat.purdue.edu/~chuanhai/projects/DS/docs/67Annals.pdf), [2](https://www.jstor.org/stable/2984504?seq=1#page_scan_tab_contents) in the context of statistical inference. It was later developed by Shafer [3](http://www.glennshafer.com/books/amte.html) into a general framework for uncertainty modeling. In the years, it has been transformed into an important computational tool for evidential reasoning in numerous application scenarios.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
